message.content:
cs.DC, cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.DS 

Reasoning: The paper discusses attacks on distributed and peer-to-peer systems, which are typically studied in the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category. The paper also discusses security and attacks, which are studied in the Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-category. The use of targeted service provision to prevent chosen nodes from providing service is a networking issue, which is studied in the Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) sub-category. The paper also discusses techniques for limiting the damage of attacks, which is a systems issue, studied in the Systems and Control (cs.SI) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses protocols and strategies for distributed systems, which is studied in the Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category.
